recipes.name: Classic Shepherd's Pie
recipes.description: A hearty, comforting layer of savory minced meat and vegetables topped with creamy mashed potatoes.
instructions: Peel and boil potatoes in salted water until tender, then mash with butter and milk until smooth.
In a large pan, brown the ground beef over medium heat and drain excess fat.
Add finely chopped onions and diced carrots to the beef, cooking until softened (about 8 minutes).
Stir in the beef broth and peas, simmering for 10 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Transfer the meat mixture to a baking dish and spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the top.
Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20 minutes or until the potato peaks are golden brown.

recipes.name: One-Pot Creamy Chicken Pasta
recipes.description: A rich and silky pasta dish where everything cooks in one pan for maximum flavor and minimum cleanup.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and sear in a large pot with oil until golden; remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté minced garlic for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the dry pasta, chicken broth, and heavy cream to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer, stirring frequently to prevent sticking, for about 10-12 minutes.
Once pasta is cooked and sauce has thickened, stir in the cooked chicken, spinach, and parmesan.
Continue stirring until the spinach has wilted and the sauce is glossy.

recipes.name: Slow-Roasted Root Vegetable Medley
recipes.description: An aromatic and healthy vegetarian dish featuring caramelized common vegetables.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 210°C (410°F).
Cut potatoes and carrots into uniform 2cm chunks to ensure even cooking.
Quarter the onions and break the garlic bulb into individual unpeeled cloves.
Toss all vegetables in a large bowl with olive oil, salt, pepper, and thyme.
Spread in a single layer on a large baking sheet, ensuring they aren't crowded.
Roast for 45 minutes, turning the vegetables halfway through until they are charred and tender.

recipes.name: Homemade Fluffy Pancakes with Fruit Compote
recipes.description: Thick, diner-style pancakes made from scratch with a quick warm fruit topping.
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine frozen berries and half the sugar; simmer over low heat until syrupy.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, remaining sugar, and baking powder.
In a separate jug, mix the milk, eggs, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk gently (lumps are okay!).
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and pour small ladles of batter.
Flip when bubbles appear on the surface and cook until golden on both sides; serve with the warm compote.

recipes.name: Hearty Lentil and Vegetable Soup
recipes.description: A protein-packed soup that stores well and uses everyday pantry staples.
instructions: Finely dice the onion, carrots, and celery (the 'soffritto' base).
Sauté the vegetables in a large pot with a splash of oil until softened.
Add minced garlic and dry lentils, stirring for 2 minutes to toast the lentils slightly.
Pour in the canned tomatoes and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer partially covered for 30 minutes.
Season generously with salt and pepper; blend a small portion of the soup if you prefer a creamier texture.

recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A traditional Roman pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, and cured pork. Creamy without using actual cream.
instructions: Boil a large pot of salted water and cook spaghetti until al dente.
While pasta cooks, fry diced bacon in a pan until crispy. Add minced garlic for the last minute.
In a small bowl, whisk the eggs and grated cheese together.
Reserve half a cup of pasta water, then drain the spaghetti.
Move the pan with bacon away from the heat. Toss in the hot pasta.
Quickly pour in the egg mixture and stir vigorously. The residual heat will create a creamy sauce without scrambling the eggs. Add pasta water if too thick.

recipes.name: Honey Garlic Chicken Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A sweet and savory chicken dish packed with vegetables and served over rice.
instructions: Cook rice according to package instructions.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, and minced garlic to make the sauce.
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and sauté in a wok or large pan until browned.
Add sliced carrots and broccoli florets with a splash of water; cover and steam for 3 minutes.
Pour the sauce over everything and simmer for 2-3 minutes until the glaze thickens and coats the chicken.

recipes.name: Quick Ground Beef Tacos
recipes.description: Family-favorite Tex-Mex dinner that's ready in under 20 minutes.
instructions: Brown the ground beef with diced onions in a skillet until fully cooked.
Season with salt, pepper, and a bit of chili powder or cumin if available.
Warm the tortillas in a dry pan or microwave.
Assemble tacos by layering beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, and grated cheese.

recipes.name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing, protein-rich vegetarian salad perfect for lunch or a side dish.
instructions: Rinse and drain the chickpeas thoroughly.
Dice the cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion into small, even pieces.
In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Add vegetables and chickpeas to the bowl and toss well to coat.
Let it sit for 10 minutes before serving to let the flavors meld.

recipes.name: Loaded Baked Potatoes
recipes.description: Crispy potato skins with a fluffy interior, topped with classic comfort ingredients.
instructions: Prick potatoes with a fork and bake at 200°C (400°F) for 1 hour until soft inside.
Fry bacon until crispy, then crumble into small bits.
Slice the top of each potato, fluff the inside with a fork, and stir in a pat of butter.
Top with grated cheese while hot so it melts, then add sour cream and bacon bits.

recipes.name: Creamy Tomato Basil Soup
recipes.description: Better than the canned version! A smooth, warm soup made from pantry staples.
instructions: Sauté chopped onion and garlic in butter until soft.
Add canned tomatoes and broth; bring to a simmer for 15 minutes.
Use a blender to process the soup until completely smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: French Toast with Caramelized Apples
recipes.description: A decadent breakfast using stale bread and common fruit.
instructions: Whisk eggs, milk, and a pinch of cinnamon in a dish. Soak bread slices for 1 minute per side.
Peel and slice apples. Sauté them in a pan with butter and sugar until brown and soft.
In another pan, fry the soaked bread until golden brown on both sides.
Serve the toast topped with the warm caramelized apples.

recipes.name: Garlic Butter Shrimp Pasta
recipes.description: Elegant, restaurant-quality seafood pasta that takes very little effort.
instructions: Cook pasta in salted water.
Melt butter in a pan and cook minced garlic for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink (about 2-3 minutes).
Toss the drained pasta into the pan with shrimp, lemon juice, and a splash of pasta water.
Mix well and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tuna Salad Sandwiches
recipes.description: The ultimate quick lunch using canned tuna and common condiments.
instructions: Drain the tuna and place it in a bowl.
Mix with mayonnaise and very finely diced onions.
Toast your bread if desired.
Spread the mixture thickly on the bread and add lettuce or tomato if you have them.

recipes.name: One-Pan Roasted Chicken & Potatoes
recipes.description: A complete meal cooked on a single tray for easy cleanup.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Cut potatoes into small cubes and place on a baking sheet with the chicken.
Drizzle with oil, add smashed garlic cloves, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat.
Roast for 40-45 minutes until chicken skin is crispy and potatoes are golden.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Chili
recipes.description: A spicy and warming stew packed with protein, perfect for cold nights.
instructions: Brown the beef and diced onion in a large pot.
Drain excess fat, then stir in chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Add the canned tomatoes, beans (drained), and broth.
Simmer on low heat for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally until thickened.

recipes.name: Caprese Salad
recipes.description: A simple Italian salad made of sliced fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil.
instructions: Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella into thick rounds.
Arrange them on a platter, alternating tomato, cheese, and a basil leaf.
Drizzle generously with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with flakey salt and black pepper before serving.

recipes.name: Easy Banana Bread
recipes.description: A moist, sweet quick bread made from over-ripe bananas.
instructions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and grease a loaf pan.
Mash bananas in a bowl and mix with melted butter.
Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla extract.
Mix in the flour and baking soda until just combined.
Pour into the pan and bake for 1 hour.

recipes.name: Mushroom Risotto
recipes.description: Creamy Italian rice dish cooked slowly with broth and savory mushrooms.
instructions: Sauté chopped onions and sliced mushrooms in butter until soft.
Add the rice and toast it for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring until liquid is absorbed before adding more.
Continue for about 20-25 minutes until rice is creamy and tender.
Stir in parmesan cheese and serve hot.

recipes.name: Ultimate Grilled Cheese
recipes.description: Crispy, buttery bread filled with melted gooey cheese.
instructions: Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Place bread butter-side down in a pan, top with cheese, and place the second slice on top (butter-side up).
Cook on medium-low heat until golden brown, then flip.
Cook the other side until crispy and the cheese is fully melted.

recipes.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
recipes.description: The classic remedy for a cold, or just a cozy dinner.
instructions: Slice carrots and celery into rounds.
Simmer vegetables in chicken broth for 15 minutes until tender.
Add the egg noodles and cook according to package time (usually 6-8 minutes).
Stir in the shredded cooked chicken and heat through.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
recipes.description: A rich meat-based tomato sauce served over pasta.
instructions: Sauté onion and garlic until soft, then add ground beef and brown well.
Pour in the tomato sauce and simmer for 30 minutes to develop flavor.
Meanwhile, cook spaghetti in salted boiling water.
Serve the sauce over the drained pasta with grated cheese.

recipes.name: Avocado Toast with Egg
recipes.description: A trendy, healthy breakfast rich in healthy fats and protein.
instructions: Toast the bread slices until crisp.
Mash the avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Fry or poach the eggs to your liking.
Spread avocado on toast, top with an egg, and sprinkle with chili flakes.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
recipes.description: A healthy sheet-pan dinner rich in Omega-3s.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place salmon and trimmed asparagus on a baking sheet.
Drizzle everything with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until salmon is flaky and asparagus is tender.

recipes.name: Bean and Cheese Quesadillas
recipes.description: A quick Mexican-inspired lunch that is crispy and cheesy.
instructions: Rinse and drain black beans.
Place a tortilla in a dry pan over medium heat.
Spread cheese, beans, and a little salsa on half the tortilla.
Fold the tortilla over and cook until crispy, then flip to crisp the other side.

recipes.name: Classic Egg Salad
recipes.description: Creamy hard-boiled egg mixture, perfect for sandwiches or salads.
instructions: Hard boil the eggs (approx 10 minutes), cool in ice water, and peel.
Chop the eggs into small pieces.
Mix in a bowl with mayonnaise, mustard, chopped green onion, salt, and pepper.
Serve on bread or lettuce leaves.

recipes.name: Potato Leek Soup
recipes.description: A French classic (Vichyssoise) that is simple, smooth, and comforting.
instructions: Clean leeks thoroughly and slice the white/light green parts.
Sauté leeks in butter until soft.
Add peeled, diced potatoes and broth; simmer for 25 minutes.
Blend the soup until smooth, stir in cream, and season.

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Homemade cookies with chewy centers and crispy edges.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Cream butter and sugar together until fluffy, then beat in the egg.
Stir in flour and a pinch of salt until a dough forms.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.

recipes.name: Quick Vegetable Fried Rice
recipes.description: Great use for leftover rice and frozen veggies.
instructions: Scramble eggs in a hot pan and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté vegetables with sesame oil.
Add the cold rice and stir-fry for 3 minutes to heat through.
Stir in the soy sauce and cooked eggs, mixing well before serving.

recipes.name: Beef Meatballs in Marinara
recipes.description: Juicy homemade meatballs simmered in a simple tomato sauce.
instructions: Mix beef, breadcrumbs, egg, parmesan, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Form into golf-ball sized meatballs.
Brown meatballs in a skillet with a little oil.
Pour marinara sauce over the meatballs, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A classic takeout favorite made fresh at home with a savory ginger-soy sauce.
instructions: Slice beef thinly against the grain.
Whisk soy sauce, minced ginger, garlic, cornstarch, and a splash of water.
Sear beef in a hot wok for 2 minutes, then remove.
Stir-fry broccoli with a splash of water to steam it.
Return beef to pan, add sauce, and toss until thickened.

recipes.name: Traditional Greek Salad
recipes.description: Fresh, crunchy, and tangy salad with blocks of feta cheese.
instructions: Chop tomatoes and cucumber into large chunks.
Slice red onion thinly.
Combine vegetables and olives in a bowl.
Top with a large block or cubes of feta.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle generously with oregano.

recipes.name: Fudgy Chocolate Brownies
recipes.description: Rich, dense chocolate squares with a crackly top.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Melt butter and chocolate together gently.
Whisk eggs and sugar until pale and fluffy, then fold in chocolate mix.
Sift in flour and cocoa powder and fold gently.
Bake in a square tin for 25-30 minutes.

recipes.name: Homemade Veggie Burgers
recipes.description: Hearty patties made from black beans and oats.
instructions: Drain and rinse beans, then mash them in a bowl (keep some texture).
Mix in oats, finely diced onion, egg, and spices.
Form into patties and chill for 10 minutes.
Fry in a pan with oil for 4-5 minutes per side.

recipes.name: Simple Chicken Curry
recipes.description: A mild creamy curry sauce suitable for the whole family.
instructions: Dice chicken and onion.
Sauté onion until soft, then add chicken and brown it.
Stir in curry powder and tomato paste, cooking for 1 minute.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 15 minutes until sauce thickens.

recipes.name: Overnight Oats with Berries
recipes.description: No-cook breakfast you prepare the night before.
instructions: Combine oats, milk, chia seeds, and honey in a jar.
Stir well to ensure chia seeds don't clump.
Top with berries.
Cover and refrigerate overnight (at least 4 hours) before eating.

recipes.name: Classic Guacamole
recipes.description: The perfect dip made from ripe avocados.
instructions: Cut avocados, remove pits, and scoop flesh into a bowl.
Mash with a fork to desired chunkiness.
Stir in lime juice, minced onion, chopped cilantro, and salt.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips.

recipes.name: Vegetable Minestrone
recipes.description: Italian soup packed with veggies, beans, and small pasta.
instructions: Dice zucchini and carrots.
Sauté veggies in a pot, then add broth and tomatoes.
Bring to a boil and add the pasta.
Simmer until pasta is cooked, then stir in the drained beans and heat through.

recipes.name: Baja Fish Tacos
recipes.description: White fish tacos with a crunchy cabbage slaw.
instructions: Cut fish into strips, dust with flour and seasoning.
Pan-fry fish in oil until golden and cooked.
Shred cabbage and toss with lime juice.
Assemble tacos with fish, cabbage, and a drizzle of mayo.

recipes.name: Shrimp Fried Rice
recipes.description: Savory rice stir-fried with juicy shrimp and peas.
instructions: Scramble eggs in a wok and remove.
Cook shrimp until pink, then add peas.
Add rice and soy sauce, stir-frying on high heat.
Mix eggs back in and serve hot.

recipes.name: French Cheese Omelette
recipes.description: A soft, pale yellow omelette with a creamy interior.
instructions: Whisk eggs vigorously until no whites remain visible.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium-low heat.
Pour in eggs and shake pan constantly while stirring with a fork.
When eggs are set but still moist, add cheese, roll, and serve.

recipes.name: Easy Apple Crumble
recipes.description: Baked fruit dessert with a buttery, sugary topping.
instructions: Peel and slice apples; place in a baking dish with cinnamon.
Rub flour, sugar, and cold butter together with fingers until crumbly.
Sprinkle crumbs over the apples.
Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 40 minutes until golden.

recipes.name: Basil Pesto Pasta
recipes.description: Vibrant green pasta sauce made from fresh herbs.
instructions: Blend basil, nuts, cheese, and oil in a food processor until smooth.
Cook pasta in salted water.
Drain pasta (reserve some water).
Toss hot pasta with the fresh pesto, adding water to thin if needed.

recipes.name: Crispy Pan-Fried Chicken Thighs
recipes.description: Juicy dark meat with perfectly crisp skin.
instructions: Pat chicken skin very dry with paper towels.
Season heavily with salt, pepper, garlic, and paprika.
Place skin-side down in a cold skillet.
Turn heat to medium-high and cook undisturbed for 15 minutes until skin is crispy.
Flip and cook for 5 more minutes.

recipes.name: Tomato Bruschetta
recipes.description: Toasted baguette topped with a fresh tomato mixture.
instructions: Mix diced tomatoes, chopped basil, oil, salt, and pepper.
Slice baguette and toast until crisp.
Rub a raw garlic clove over the hot toasted bread.
Spoon the tomato mixture onto the bread.

recipes.name: Homemade Hummus
recipes.description: Smooth chickpea dip, much better than store-bought.
instructions: Blend tahini and lemon juice until whipped.
Add chickpeas, garlic, cumin, and salt.
Blend while slowly adding ice water to make it ultra-smooth.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil.

recipes.name: New England Clam Chowder
recipes.description: Rich, white creamy soup with clams and potatoes.
instructions: Fry bacon pieces until crisp, remove, cooked onion in fat.
Add diced potatoes and juice from clam cans (add water to cover).
Simmer until potatoes are tender.
Stir in cream and clams, heating gently (do not boil). Top with bacon.

recipes.name: Classic Cobb Salad
recipes.description: A composed salad with rows of ingredients.
instructions: Chop lettuce and place on a large platter.
Arrange diced chicken, bacon, eggs, avocado, and cheese in neat rows on top.
Serve with red wine vinaigrette on the side.

recipes.name: Mixed Berry Smoothie
recipes.description: Refreshing drink packed with antioxidants.
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender.
Blend on high until smooth and purple.
Add more milk if it is too thick to drink.

recipes.name: Stovetop Macaroni and Cheese
recipes.description: Creamy, cheesy pasta made from scratch without baking.
instructions: Cook macaroni; drain and set aside.
Melt butter in the pot, whisk in flour, then slowly whisk in milk.
Simmer until sauce thickens.
Remove from heat, stir in cheese until melted, then mix in the pasta.
